TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit StorePermission extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: Controls access to stores containing X.509 certificates. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks StorePermission controls the access that code is granted to X.509 stores. The permission is based on flags representing the access levels that apply to every store.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState state) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with either fully restricted or unrestricted permission state.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The permission object provides either fully restricted (`None`) or `Unrestricted` access to X.509 stores. If fully restricted (`None`), the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StorePermission.Flags%2A> property can then be set to specify the type of access allowed.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Security.Permissions.StorePermissionFlags flag) cil managed

Docs.param: A bitwise combination of the values.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified access.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `flag` parameter specifies the permitted access to X.509 stores. The specified permitted access applies to all stores. It is not possible to specify access to an individual store.

Docs.exception: is not a valid combination of values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A copy of a permission represents the same access to resources as the original permission.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of access allowed by the current permission.
Docs.value: A bitwise combination of the values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Flags property specifies the permitted access to X.509 stores. X.509 stores are physical stores used to persist and manage X.509 certificates.

Docs.exception: An attempt is made to set this property to an invalid value. See for the valid values.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void FromXml(class System.Security.SecurityElement securityElement) cil managed

Docs.param: A that contains the XML encoding to use to reconstruct the permission.
Docs.summary: Reconstructs a permission with a specified state from an XML encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The FromXml method reconstructs a <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StorePermission> object from an XML encoding defined by the <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement> class. Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StorePermission.ToXml%2A> method to XML-encode the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StorePermission>, including state information.

Docs.exception:
is not a valid permission element.
-or-
The version number in is not valid.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to intersect with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission that is the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the intersection of the current permission and the specified permission. This new permission is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations that both permissions describe in common. Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection.

Docs.exception: s not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to test for the subset relationship. This permission must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The current permission is a subset of the specified permission if the current permission specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission. For example, a permission that represents access to C:\example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\\. If this method returns `true`, the current permission represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission.

Docs.exception: is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the current permission is unrestricted.
Docs.returns: if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks An unrestricted permission represents access to all resources protected by the permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the permission and its current state.
Docs.returns: A that contains an XML encoding of the permission, including any state information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.StorePermission.FromXml%2A> method to restore the state information from a <xref:System.Security.SecurityElement>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.
Docs.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
Docs.returns: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The result of a call to Union is a permission that represents all operations represented by both the current permission and the specified permission. Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.

Docs.exception: is not and is not of the same type as the current permission.
